result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeanette D Hopson

records.addlTxt: Hearing on December 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.

9:25 AM Defendant Jeanette D Hopson in court.  Attorney Priya Barnes in court for Jeanette D Hopson.  Prosecuting attorney Jack A. Pitzo in court for the State of Wisconsin. This matter is tagging along with the defendant's other felony matter.
Hearing scheduled for December 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on November 2, 2022 at 09:15 am.

3:16 PM Defendant Jeanette D Hopson not in court.  Attorney Priya Barnes in court for Jeanette D Hopson. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defense does not know why the Defendant does not appear today. Defendant has picked up a second case (22CF913), preliminary hearing is set in that case. Defense requests a stayed capias until 11/02/2022 preliminary hearing date. 

Court will stay any capias until 11/02/22, when preliminary hearing on 22CF1570 is set.
Hearing scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Prior: 1220 W Vliet St, Milwaukee, WI 53205

1:52 PM Defendant Jeanette D Hopson in court.  Attorney Priya Barnes in court for Jeanette D Hopson.  Prosecuting attorney Lindsey Hirt in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Defense is asking for a plea/sentencing date in 45 days for the Defendant to complete some programming. Court sets.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 31, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Hearing on September 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant waives her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

10:38 AM Defendant Jeanette D Hopson in court with attorney Priya Barnes.  Patrick Ryan Campbell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Preliminary hearing on August 5, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.
